description:
As a Business Process Analyst, you will work directly with Google Cloud teams to optimize processes for the organization's selling systems and strategy initiatives. You'll be responsible for the business process architecture of an enterprise sized program focused on re-imagining the business processes and systems across marketing, sales, support and partner.

As a strategic thinker, with excellent business acumen, you can leverage an understanding of sales processes within the Opportunity Life-cycle to guide decision making, solve problems, provide analytical insight and business judgement to support strategic and tactical initiatives across the Cloud organization

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in Business Analyst/Program/Portfolio Management role.
  • 3 years of experience working in CRM and/or supporting a global sales organization.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in Salesforce, Sales Cloud, CPQ, Billing, SQL and ERP.
  • Ability to develop and translate business requirements to functional requirements, identify gaps and execute testing of new, or modified, systems functionality or rules.
  • Understanding of sales and marketing business objectives with a proven track record of streamlining the processes and related system changes on lead to cash and identify inefficiencies current or proposed processes.
  • Excellent communication skills and problem solving skills with the ability to articulate solutions to business stakeholders, technical and non-technical people to all levels of staff and management.
  • Demonstrated ability to drive the end-to-end life-cycle of developing integration solutions, from conception to launch and post-launch support.
responsibilities:
• Create business requirement documents, user stories, functional specifications, and user acceptance test scenarios.
  • Lead workshops to gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, business analysis, architecture diagrams and task/workflow analysis.
  • Interact, consult and partner with members of the global Google Cloud business and extended teams including but not limited to Engineering, Business Intelligence, Sales and Data Governance to identify and build solutions and processes.
  • Understand and design configuration and workflow for new processes and systems that maximize functionality and minimize customization.
title: Quote to Cash Business Process Analyst, Cloud Business Transformation Organization
